title: Villa Montaña Salad Dressing
ingredients: 1 teaspoon parsley, chopped (you may substitute 8 to 10 cilantro sprigs instead)
1 teaspoon celery, chopped (I’ve used about ½ stalk of celery)
instructions: Place all of the ingredients, except the oil, in a blender as you clean and prepare them.  Cap the blender and purée the ingredients.  Stop the blender, remove the center cap from the blender container, turn the blender on again and slowly pour in the oil until all the oil has been incorporated.
Pour the salad dressing intended for the table into a salad dressing jar and the extra dressing into a Mason jar, cap, and refrigerate.
Source:  Villa Montaña Cuisine by Ray Coté with collaboration of Melva Sannebeck, published by Imprenta Nuevo Mundo, S. A., Mexico, © by Raymond J. Coté 1962.
